word: To eat eagerly and quickly, often in large amounts; to swallow or use something up rapidly | Devour [dɪˈvaʊər]
A structured or often formal discussion in which people present opposing viewpoints and argue for or against an issue | debate [dɪˈbeɪt]
Made a facial expression by contracting the brow to show disapproval or concern | Frowned [fraʊnd]
| English: to abandon or cancel a plan, project, or item; to discard something as no longer useful | scrap [skræp]
Showing self-control and moderation; not displaying strong emotion or intense feeling | Restrained [rɪˈstreɪnd]
| to intentionally hold back or hide feelings, information, or reactions | suppressed, /səˈprɛst/
To waste money, time, or resources in a careless or reckless way. | Squander [ˈskwɒn.dər]
Advocate /ˈæd.və.keɪt/ — Example: “She advocates for equal rights for all people.” — Formal
